qas.question: What lead to the UK to subscribe to the agreement on Social Policy?

answers.text: the election of the UK Labour Party to government
the election of the UK Labour Party to government in 1997
the election of the UK Labour Party to government

qas.question: When did the UK formally subscribe to the Agreement on Social Policy?
Which directive mentioned was created in 1994?
When was the Parental Leave directive created?
What did the Works Council Directive require?

plausible_answers.text: the UK formally subscribed to the Agreement on Social Policy

qas.question: What did not follow the election of the UK Labour Party to government?
When did the UK not subscribe to the Agreement on the Social Policy?
What did not require workforce consultation in business?
When was the Parental Leave directive rejected?

plausible_answers.text: policy initiatives in various social policy areas

qas.question: What has the European Union not undertaken following the adoption of the Social Charter?

context: Following <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>the election of the UK Labour Party to government<a0_2/><a0_0/> in <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b6_0>1997<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/><a0_1/>, <b5_0>the UK formally subscribed to the Agreement on Social Policy<b5_0/>, which allowed it to be included with minor amendments as the Social Chapter of the 1997 Treaty of Amsterdam. The UK subsequently adopted the main legislation previously agreed under the Agreement on Social Policy, <a2_1>the <b7_0>1994 <a2_0><a2_2>Works Council Directive<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, which required <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>workforce consultation in businesses<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>, and the <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b8_0>1996<b8_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> Parental Leave Directive. In the 10 years following the 1997 Treaty of Amsterdam and adoption of the Social Chapter the European Union has undertaken <b9_0>policy initiatives in various social policy areas<b9_0/>, including labour and industry relations, equal opportunity, health and safety, public health, protection of children, the disabled and elderly, poverty, migrant workers, education, training and youth.
